Create structured color palettes with unlimited base colors, each generating smooth, adjustable gradients with 10 stops, labeled from 50 to 900 following the Material Design naming convention (from lightest to darkest).


Tinctify gives you full visual and numeric control over hue, saturation, lightness, and naming â€” all in an intuitive and powerful interface.

ğŸ“¥ Import/Export with Color Charts

ğŸ”— Figma Variable Integration

Introduction

The "Base64 Generator" plugin enables you to convert selected Figma elements into Base64-encoded images. You can preview the generated image, adjust its resolution, and easily copy the Base64 code to your clipboard.


Function Description

  1. Generate Base64: Convert any selected Figma element into a Base64-encoded image.
  2. Preview Image: View the Base64 image directly in the plugin interface.
  3. Image Resolution: Adjust the image's resolution using a multiplier (e.g., 1x, 2x).
  4. Copy to Clipboard: Copy the generated Base64 code with a single click.


How to Use

  1. Select a Figma element (image, vector, or other graphic elements).
  2. Open the "Base64 Generator" plugin.
  3. Choose a resolution multiplier (1x, 2x, etc.).
  4. Click "Generate Base64" to generate the Base64 code.
  5. View the generated image and copy the Base64 code to the clipboard.


Precautions

  1. Only visible layers can be converted into Base64. Hidden layers will be ignored.
  2. The plugin is designed for images and vector elements.
  3. Ensure the image size is appropriate for better performance when generating Base64.

Introduction

Slice Export Assistant Pro is a powerful tool designed for Figma users to streamline the process of slicing and exporting assets. This plugin allows you to easily manage and export multiple slices with customizable naming rules, formats, and scales.


Function Description

  1. Advanced Slice Management: Automatically slice and export assets based on user-defined rules.
  2. Customizable Export Options: Choose formats like PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, or WEBP, with customizable scales and prefixes.
  3. Batch Operations: Export multiple slices in one go with the ability to define custom naming rules.
  4. Translation Support: One-click translation of slice names to English, with support for other languages.
  5. User-Friendly Interface: Intuitive and easy-to-navigate interface to manage export settings and slices.
  6. Export Preview: Preview slices before exporting to ensure accuracy.
  7. History & Quick Access: Save and quickly reuse previous naming rules with an easy-to-use history feature.
  8. Overlay and Loading Animation: Provides real-time feedback with loading overlays and animations for a smoother user experience.


How to Use

  1. Set Up Slicing Rules: Input your custom naming rules in the input field.
  2. Select Slices: Click on the â€œGet Slicesâ€ button to automatically detect slices in your project.
  3. Customize Exports: Choose your desired export format, scale, and prefix.
  4. Batch Export: Click â€œDownloadâ€ to batch export your slices in your selected format.
  5. Translation: Use the "Translate" button to instantly translate slice names from Chinese to English.
  6. Full Selection: Use the "Select All" button for easy selection of all slices.


Important Notes

  1. Ensure you select slices before exporting.
  2. Only supported formats (PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, WEBP) can be used for export.
  3. The translation feature supports only Chinese-to-English translations for now.

Slice Export Assistant Pro is a powerful tool designed for Figma users to streamline the process of slicing and exporting assets. This plugin allows you to easily manage and export multiple slices with customizable naming rules, formats, and scales.


Function Description

  1. Advanced Slice Management: Automatically slice and export assets based on user-defined rules.
  2. Customizable Export Options: Choose formats like PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, or WEBP, with customizable scales and prefixes.
  3. Batch Operations: Export multiple slices in one go with the ability to define custom naming rules.
  4. Translation Support: One-click translation of slice names to English, with support for other languages.
  5. User-Friendly Interface: Intuitive and easy-to-navigate interface to manage export settings and slices.
  6. Export Preview: Preview slices before exporting to ensure accuracy.
  7. History & Quick Access: Save and quickly reuse previous naming rules with an easy-to-use history feature.
  8. Overlay and Loading Animation: Provides real-time feedback with loading overlays and animations for a smoother user experience.


How to Use

  1. Set Up Slicing Rules: Input your custom naming rules in the input field.
  2. Select Slices: Click on the â€œGet Slicesâ€ button to automatically detect slices in your project.
  3. Customize Exports: Choose your desired export format, scale, and prefix.
  4. Batch Export: Click â€œDownloadâ€ to batch export your slices in your selected format.
  5. Translation: Use the "Translate" button to instantly translate slice names from Chinese to English.
  6. Full Selection: Use the "Select All" button for easy selection of all slices.


Important Notes

  1. Ensure you select slices before exporting.
  2. Only supported formats (PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, WEBP) can be used for export.
  3. The translation feature supports only Chinese-to-English translations for now.
137637.tagline: Slice and Export with Ease â€” Professional Tool for Designers

plugins.name: æ‰¹é‡ç»„ä»¶å¡«å…… Batch Component Fill
plugins.description:
Introduction

Batch Component Fill is a highly efficient and user-friendly Figma plugin designed for designers and teams who need to quickly batch-fill component content. It supports data pasting from Excel, auto-layout frames, and highly customizable workflows.


Function Description

  1. Batch Component Fill: Fill text boxes of multiple components at once.
  2. Excel Data Paste: Copy data directly from Excel and paste it into the plugin. The plugin will parse the table and generate corresponding content automatically.
  3. Auto-Layout Support: Generated content is wrapped in an auto-layout frame with adjustable spacing.
  4. Progress Feedback: Provides real-time progress feedback during the filling process.
  5. Text Layer Conflict Detection: If there are conflicting text layer names in the component, the plugin will flag and notify the user.


Usage

  1. Open the plugin "Batch Component Fill" in Figma.
  2. Select a component or instance with text layers.
  3. Paste table data (supports copying from Excel directly into the plugin).
  4. Click "Generate Content" to automatically generate component instances wrapped in an auto-layout frame based on the data.
  5. After generation, you can manually adjust the results if needed.


Notes

  1. Component Selection Requirement: Ensure a component or instance with text layers is selected.
  2. Unique Text Layer Names: Ensure all text layer names in the component are unique to avoid data conflicts.
  3. Excel Data Format: Make sure table data is properly formatted, with each cell corresponding to a text layer in the component.
  4. Auto-Layout Limitations: Generated content is automatically arranged in a vertically oriented auto-layout frame with a default spacing of 50px, which can be adjusted manually.

plugins.name: å›¾å±‚æ¸…ç†å¤§å¸ˆ Layer Cleaner
plugins.description:
Introduction

Layer Cleaner is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help you efficiently manage your layers. With easy-to-use functions, it allows you to fold layers, clear hidden layers, or do both at once. Clean and organize your workspace for smoother design workflows.


Function Description

  1. Fold Layers: Collapses all layers in the selected elements, including groups, frames, and components.
  2. Clear Hidden Layers: Removes all hidden layers under the selected elements, improving file performance.
  3. Fold and Clear Hidden Layers: Combines both actionsâ€”folding all layers and clearing hidden layersâ€”into one simple click.


How to Use

  1. Select the elements you want to work with.
  2. Choose one of the options in the plugin:
  3. Fold Layers to collapse all layers.
  4. Clear Hidden Layers to delete all hidden layers.
  5. Fold and Clear to perform both actions at once.
  6. The plugin will notify you once the action is complete.


Notes

137622.description:
Introduction

Layer Cleaner is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help you efficiently manage your layers. With easy-to-use functions, it allows you to fold layers, clear hidden layers, or do both at once. Clean and organize your workspace for smoother design workflows.


Function Description

  1. Fold Layers: Collapses all layers in the selected elements, including groups, frames, and components.
  2. Clear Hidden Layers: Removes all hidden layers under the selected elements, improving file performance.
  3. Fold and Clear Hidden Layers: Combines both actionsâ€”folding all layers and clearing hidden layersâ€”into one simple click.


How to Use

  1. Select the elements you want to work with.
  2. Choose one of the options in the plugin:
  3. Fold Layers to collapse all layers.
  4. Clear Hidden Layers to delete all hidden layers.
  5. Fold and Clear to perform both actions at once.
  6. The plugin will notify you once the action is complete.


Notes

  1. The plugin only affects the selected layers and elements.
  2. Make sure to save your work before using the plugin, as the changes are irreversible.

plugins.description:
Introduction

The PDF Export Tool is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help designers effortlessly export selected design elements into high-quality PDF files. Whether exporting a single element or multiple elements, the PDF Export Tool streamlines the conversion process, enhancing your productivity.


Function Description

  1. Multiple Element Export: Export multiple selected design elements at once, with each element automatically generating a separate page in the PDF.
  2. High-Quality Images: Ensures that the exported PDF maintains the original resolution and clarity of your design elements.
  3. Easy Operation: Complete the export process with just a few clicks, eliminating the need for complex settings.
  4. Automatic Naming: The generated PDF file is automatically named â€œexported_elements.pdfâ€ for easy retrieval and management.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select Elements: In Figma, select one or more design elements you wish to export.
  2. Run the Plugin: Navigate to Plugins > Development > PDFå¯¼å‡ºå·¥å…· PDF Export Tool in the menu bar.
  3. Export PDF: In the plugin window that appears, click the â€œExport as PDFâ€ button.
  4. Download File: The plugin will automatically generate and download a PDF file containing your selected elements.


Precautions

  1. Compatibility: Ensure that the selected elements support export in PNG format; otherwise, the export may fail.
  2. File Size: Exporting a large number of high-resolution elements may result in a larger PDF file and may take more time to generate.

plugins.name: è‰²å€¼è½¬æ¢å™¨ Color Format Converter
plugins.description:
Introduction

"Color Format Converter" is a lightweight Figma plugin that simplifies viewing, converting, and copying all colors (including child elements) within your selected objects. It supports multiple color formatsâ€”Hex, RGB, HSL, HSB, UIColorâ€”and enhances your workflow efficiency.


Function Description

  1. Extract all color information (solid fills, gradients, strokes, and text colors) from the selected layers and their children.
  2. Display colors in various formats: Hex (with alpha), RGB(A), HSL(A), HSB(A), UIColor.
  3. Parallel display of a stable column (Hex+Opacity) and a convertible format column. The stable column remains fixed, while the convertible format can be switched from a dropdown.
  4. Click the convertible format value to copy it, with a success notification appearing in Figma.


Usage

  1. Install and run the plugin in Figma.
  2. Select any object (including groups or components). The plugin automatically extracts all related colors.
  3. Use the dropdown in the plugin panel to change the displayed convertible color format.
  4. Click on a convertible format value to copy it and receive a success notification.


Notes

  1. Ensure a secure context (HTTPS) for direct clipboard API usage. A fallback method is employed otherwise.
  2. If no color is present in the selection, the plugin will display an empty list.

plugins.name: Resonote - Share and Collaborate
plugins.description:
Overview

Ever found a stakeholder wandering your file looking for a design? Or having to share the same link number of times to get some feedback. With this plugin you can create a dedicated collaborative space with a sharable link for a specific design within your file. Within this space you can easily collect feedback and log actions. Here's an example of the collaborative space.


How to use

  1. First locate the design frame you want create a dedicated space for, it can be a single design or multiple designs within a frame.
  2. Then within the plugin add a name for the design project and the iteration you're adding with a quick description - it could be a feedback request or annotations for the design.
  3. Finally choose the format you want to upload the frame to the dedicated space, it can either be an image or embedded Figma frame.
  4. After you upload the frame to the dedicated space the link will be generated below, if you want to add to the same project after, use the same link and choose 'add to project'.


Example use cases

  1. Tracking design iterations and collecting feedback from the team and stakeholder, with each new iteration including how the feedback was actioned and how the design evolved.
  2. Showcasing different states of design evolution (crawl, walk, run) for stakeholders in a easily sharable link tracking related feedback.
  3. Using iterations for different parts of the designs and tracking related feedback in one space to see how the overall design evolves.


Note

  1. When uploading as an image will make the selected frame or section content public, use at own risk or switch to embed to retain existing file access settings.
  2. Plugin and collaborative feedback space is currently in alpha stage, things will evolve and any feedback or suggestion are more then welcome!
plugins.tagline: Create and share a feedback space to collaborate with your team and stakeholders

plugins.name: BartTextToDesignNow
plugins.description:
Iâ€™m excited to share a new Figma plugin Iâ€™ve been working on. Itâ€™s still in the early stages, but the idea is simple and powerful: you can describe what you want to see, and the plugin will draw it for you. Iâ€™m really thankful for any support or feedback you can offer as I continue to develop it.


At the moment, the plugin is focused on basic shapes. For example, you could type, "Draw a rectangle, 450 width, 600 height, 45 stroke size, red stroke color, yellow fill color," and the plugin will generate that exact shape on your canvas. The key is to keep your instructions straightforward and precise.


To help you along the way, the plugin provides helpful hints at the bottom of the screen as you type your commands. This should make it easier to craft the right instruction and get the results youâ€™re looking for.


If you make a mistake or want to adjust something, you can use the "Previous" command to go back to the last command you entered. This allows you to easily refine your design without starting from scratch.


This plugin is just getting started, so your feedback and support are crucial as I continue to improve and add more features. Thank you for trying it out!

plugins.name: Fair Colors
plugins.description:
Fair Colors is a Figma plugin designed to streamline your color workflow, helping you manage, apply, and audit colors within your designs.


Key Features:


Extract Colors: Quickly grab all unique colors from your current selection, including solid fills and gradients.

Organize Palettes: Create and manage multiple color palettes, giving them custom names for easy organization.

Apply & Replace: Effortlessly apply saved colors to selected layers or replace existing colors throughout your selection.

Smart Highlighting: Instantly highlight all layers in your canvas that use a specific color, making auditing and adjustments a breeze.

Track Changes: Identify and manage color discrepancies by generating a "Fair Colors Changes" frame that visually shows differences between your saved palette and colors found in your selection.

Export Tokenized Colors: Generate a clean, tokenized reference frame of your used colors, perfect for design system documentation or developer handoff.

Fair Color helps you maintain consistency, identify rogue colors, and accelerate your design process by putting powerful color management tools right at your fingertips.
plugins.tagline: Local Color Palette System

plugins.name: Atomic - Multi Brand Token Engine
plugins.description:
Atomic transforms a single hex code into a complete set of design tokens and themes, instantly applying your brand's unique identity across all your apps and websites. This powerful plugin streamlines multi-brand design systems and campaigns, allowing you to effortlessly generate themes, export developer-ready tokens, and maintain consistency across every product.


Features:


Theme Generator

Define your core brand colors and let Atomic intelligently adjust shades to create a complete palette. You can then export this palette directly to your Figma canvas or instantly generate Figma variables as a complete theme. This helps you create brand modes instantly with proper semantics, enabling faster iterations for brand campaigns and seamless experimentation with colors, fonts, and effects.


Export to JSON

Export all your Figma design tokens directly to JSON, providing developers with a consistent and up-to-date source of truth. This significantly speeds up hand-offs and reduces implementation discrepancies.


Effects

Precise shadow colors and configure them for smoother, more nuanced visual effects. Apply consistent effects across all your brands, updating global styles with ease.


Spacing & Radius

Establish a consistent visual rhythm and hierarchy using dedicated tokens for spacing and border radius. You can use default values or easily adjust them to perfectly align with your brand guidelines.


Neutrals and Semantics

Automatically generates essential primitives and neutral colors. These foundational elements are crucial for building a robust and flexible design system that scales across multiple brands.



Any feedback?

Connect at hello@uxmurali.com

accepted.name: Murali
accepted.description: Product Designer who strives to create meaningful experiences that make people's lives better.

137859.release_notes:
## [2.7.1] - 2025-06-15

### ğŸ› Critical Bug Fixes
- **Fixed standalone node parsing**: Now correctly parses both standalone node definitions and edge connections
  - **Issue**: Nodes were displaying IDs (Q, C, T) instead of text labels ("Pick a drink", "Coffee", "Tea")
  - **Root cause**: Parser only processed edge connections, ignored standalone node definitions
  - **Solution**: Enhanced parser to handle both `Q{Pick a drink}` definitions AND `Q --> C` connections
- **Complete syntax support**: All node types now correctly display text labels
  - `[Rectangle text]` âœ…
  - `{Diamond text}` âœ… 
  - `(Ellipse text)` âœ…
  - `([Ellipse text])` âœ… (both ellipse syntaxes supported)

### ğŸ”§ Code Quality Improvements
- **Removed dead code**: Eliminated unused `_calculateLegacyLayout()` function (39 lines removed)
- **Optimized function signatures**: Removed unused `levels` parameter from `resolveNodeCollisions()`
- **Consolidated configuration**: Created unified `SHAPE_CONFIG` object for all node types
  - **Before**: Scattered across `getShapeTextConfig()`, `getNodeColors()`, `getShapeType()`
  - **After**: Single source of truth with `SHAPE_CONFIG` and `ROLE_COLORS` objects
- **Enhanced documentation**: Added comprehensive JSDoc comments for all public functions
- **Improved linting**: Created `.eslintignore` to exclude generated `code.js` file

### ğŸ§ª Testing & Validation
- **Extensive test coverage**: Verified with 5 diverse Mermaid test cases
  - Mixed node types with edge labels âœ…
  - Left-right layouts with long text âœ…
  - Complex branching decision trees âœ…
  - Simple linear processes âœ…
  - Multiple start/end points âœ…
- **Version logging**: Added console logging to verify latest code is running
- **Clean builds**: All code compiles without errors and passes linting

### ğŸ“Š Benefits
- âœ… **Correct text display** - All node text labels now show properly instead of IDs
- âœ… **Complete Mermaid support** - Both standalone definitions and edge syntax work perfectly
- âœ… **Maintainable codebase** - Cleaner code with consolidated configuration and documentation
- âœ… **Production ready** - Robust parsing handles real-world Mermaid syntax patterns
- âœ… **Developer experience** - JSDoc documentation and clean code structure

plugins.name: Pinnaflow Collections
plugins.description:
Figma CMS Table Generator helps you structure CMS data directly in your Figma file, and export it as a Webflow-compatible CSV.


With this plugin, you can:


ğŸ—‚ Create CMS collections by defining field names and types

ğŸ§© Add CMS items directly inside the selected component

ğŸ“¤ Export your data to CSV â€” ready for Webflow import

ğŸ“„ Use text-based field definitions for fast editing

ğŸ–¼ Beautiful, responsive UI with built-in tooltips and help modal


How to use:


  1. Select a component or create a new one via the plugin
  2. Add a frame named "CMS Properties" inside it
  3. Add text layers in the format Field Name | Field Type
  4. Switch to the "Create Item" tab to populate items
  5. Export to CSV when ready


Works best when used with components designed for CMS collections or mockups.

plugins.name: TokenBoard
plugins.description:
TokenBoard is an advanced Figma plugin designed to give you full visibility and control over local variable collections â€” whether youâ€™re building a robust design system, managing light/dark modes, or maintaining consistent styles across teams.


Features Overview


Explore Variables by Collection, Scope & Mode

  1. Browse all local variable collections in your Figma file
  2. Organized as expandable tree structures by collection, group, and nested groups
  3. View and compare values across all modes (e.g. â€œLightâ€, â€œDarkâ€)


Smart Search

  1. Instant full-text search across variable names, values, types, and scopes
  2. Highlights matches inside nested groups
  3. Keeps scroll position and selection while typing


Visual & Semantic Display

  1. Color tokens show live swatches, hex values, and opacity
  2. Boolean, number, string tokens are clearly labeled
  3. Aliases display as links to target variables with inline previews


Aliases & References

  1. Displays alias chains with resolved values
  2. Clickable interface to explore alias references
  3. Supports setting or detaching aliases via selector popup


Inline Editing of Values

  1. Edit most values directly inside the table: Colors (rgba), Strings, Numbers, Booleans, Aliases
  2. Shows validation states and editable highlights
  3. Supports editing multiple modes in a variable


Selection-Aware Variable Inspector

  1. Automatically detects all variables applied to the selected node(s) on the canvas
  2. Displays them grouped by collection, scope, and mode
  3. Resolves and highlights any aliases used
  4. Handles nested selections and multiple nodes
  5. Edit Values Directly from the Selection
  6. Selection-based variable data is cached with a unique key
  7. Improves performance when switching between nodes
  8. Cache is auto-expired after 5 minutes or can be manually refreshed


Batch Update

  1. Send a list of changes (e.g. 30+ variable updates) in one click
  2. Type conversion (color objects, strings, aliases)
  3. Font loading for FONT_FAMILY variables (with fallback to alternative styles if â€œRegularâ€ not available)
  4. Scope checks and error recovery per variable
  5. Returns a report of successful and failed updates


Performance Optimizations

  1. In-memory caching of selection data with expiry (5 min)
  2. Caches up to 50 different selections to reduce API calls
  3. Tracks which variables are already loaded to avoid duplication


Figma API Compatibility Handling

  1. Graceful fallback if variable APIs or methods are unavailable
  2. Error messages guide user to fix or retry


Clean, Resizable UI

  1. Fully styled native-like UI with Figma theme support (light/dark)
  2. Flexible layout with resizable panel
  3. Displays progress during data load
  4. Empty states and error messages styled for clarity


Ideal Use Cases

  1. Design system audits
  2. Token cleanup and maintenance
  3. Visual QA of theme modes
  4. Alias linking and optimization
  5. Batch updates to variable values
  6. Color or typography token management


Compatibility

  1. Built for the latest Figma API with full variable support
  2. Works in Figma files only (not FigJam)
  3. Requires Variables feature enabled in your Figma workspace

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Advanced Figma plugin for browsing, editing, and batch-managing local variables, modes, and aliases

plugins.name: Mermaid to FigJam
plugins.description:
## âœ¨ New Features


### FigJam â†’ Mermaid Conversion

- **Section-based conversion**: Select any FigJam Section and convert all flowchart elements within it to Mermaid code

- **Smart node mapping**: Automatically generates clean, sequential node IDs (A, B, C... AA, AB... for 26+ nodes)

- **Shape recognition**: Correctly identifies rectangles, diamonds, and circles from FigJam shapes

- **Connection preservation**: Maintains all connections with labels and arrow types

- **Large diagram support**: Handles flowcharts with 100+ nodes efficiently


### Enhanced UI/UX

- **Dynamic button states**: FigJam â†’ Mermaid button is enabled only when a Section is selected

- **Improved UI layout**: Cleaner interface with Sample Flowchart and Clear links

- **Real-time feedback**: Clear status messages for successful conversions

- **Bilingual support**: Works seamlessly with both English and Japanese text


### Technical Improvements

- **Robust error handling**: Graceful handling of edge cases and missing connections

- **Performance optimizations**: Efficient processing of large diagrams

- **Debug logging**: Comprehensive logging for troubleshooting (in development mode)


## ğŸ”„ Conversion Capabilities


### Mermaid â†’ FigJam (Enhanced)

- Automatic Section creation with timestamp

- Optimized layout algorithm with branch/merge point detection

- Smart connector routing to minimize overlaps

- Support for all Mermaid node shapes and connection types


### FigJam â†’ Mermaid (New)

- Clean Mermaid code generation

- Preserves flowchart structure and logic

- Handles complex branching and merging patterns

- Maintains connection labels and directionality


## ğŸ“‹ Usage


1. **Mermaid â†’ FigJam**: Paste your Mermaid code and click convert

2. **FigJam â†’ Mermaid**: Select a Section containing your flowchart and click convert

3. **Sample Flowchart**: Click to insert a sample Mermaid diagram

4. **Clear**: Reset the text area for new input


## ğŸ› ï¸ Technical Details


- **Node ID Generation**: Intelligent mapping system supporting unlimited nodes

- **Shape Mapping**: FigJam shapes are correctly interpreted as Mermaid syntax

- **Section Detection**: Automatic detection of selected Sections for conversion

- **Color Scheme**: Light blue nodes (#C2E5FF) with blue connectors (#3DADFF)


## ğŸ› Bug Fixes


- Fixed node positioning issues within Sections

- Resolved connector overlap problems in complex diagrams

- Corrected shape detection for rounded rectangles

- Fixed text encoding issues for Japanese characters


## ğŸ”§ Requirements


- FigJam (Figma) desktop or web application

- Sections must be used for FigJam â†’ Mermaid conversion


## ğŸš€ Getting Started


1. Install the plugin in FigJam

2. Try the Sample Flowchart to see the conversion in action

3. Use your own Mermaid code or convert existing FigJam diagrams


---


**Note**: This plugin is designed to work with standard flowchart patterns. Complex FigJam designs with custom shapes or annotations may not convert perfectly to Mermaid syntax.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly convert between Mermaid code and FigJam diagrams. Code to visual,    visual to code.

plugins.name: Data Grid Master
plugins.description:
Apply full spreadsheets to any data grid of your choice in Figma within seconds.

Data Grid Master supports CSV uploads or copy-paste from Excel, Google Sheets, or any spreadsheet tool.

Just pick a single cell in your grid, let the plugin find all other cells that match it and select the property to modify if it is a component. Text nodes are set directly.

Choose whether to upload a CSV file or paste your spreadsheet data, hit apply â€” done.


Tested with AG Grid, MUI-X Data Grid, and many others â€” works with any professional data grid setup.

The only requirement: cells must share the same name in Figma.


Full tutorial is available here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L9baIywE7JE

accepted.name: Evgenii Shmoish

plugins.name: SheetSync For DeSo
plugins.description:
SheetSync For DeSo: Google Sheets to Figma Design Variations


SheetSync is a powerful Figma plugin that creates design variations directly from your Google Sheets data, saving you hours of repetitive work. Perfect for generating product catalogs, social media posts, campaign assets, and more.


With SheetSync, simply select a template frame, connect your Google Sheet, and watch as the plugin automatically generates variations with customized text and images. Text fields with "#" prefixes automatically populate from your sheet's columns, while image placeholders update with URLs from your data.


Key Features:

â€¢ Generate dozens of design variations in seconds

â€¢ Dynamic text population from spreadsheet data

â€¢ Automatic image placement from URL sources

â€¢ Simple template setup with intuitive naming conventions

â€¢ Manual image upload option for greater flexibility


Streamline your design workflow and ensure consistency across all your variations with SheetSync For DeSo.

Introduction

This plugin helps you batch replace local text styles in Figma with just a few clicks. It's ideal for managing multilingual design systems or switching between style versions efficiently.


Function Description

  1. Automatically loads all local text styles from the current file
  2. Provides dropdowns to select source and target styles
  3. Replaces text styles for selected text nodes in bulk
  4. Shows an empty state message if no local styles exist


How to Use

  1. Open the plugin to load local text styles automatically;
  2. Select the source and target styles from the dropdowns;
  3. Select the text nodes you want to modify;
  4. Click the â€œReplaceâ€ button to apply the change.


Notes

  1. Only local text styles are supported (no team styles);
  2. The plugin will show an empty state if no local styles exist;
  3. Make sure to select text layers before using the plugin.
